descript.abstract: This dataset represents a compilation of data from various government agencies throughout the City of New York. The underlying geography is derived from the Tax Lot Polygon feature class which is part of the Department of Finance's Digital Tax Map (DTM). The tax lots have been clipped to the shoreline, as defined by NYCMap planimetric features. The attribute information is from the Department of City Planning's PLUTO data. The attribute data pertains to tax lot and building characteristics and geographic, political and administrative information for each tax lot in New York City. The Tax Lot Polygon feature class and PLUTO are derived from different sources. As a result, some PLUTO records did not have a corresponding tax lot in the Tax Lot polygon feature class at the time of release. These records are included in a separate non-geographic PLUTO Only DBase (*.dbf) table. There are a number of reasons why there can be a tax lot in PLUTO that does not match the DTM; the most common reason is that the various source files are maintained by different departments and divisions with varying update cycles and criteria for adding and removing records. The attribute definitions for the PLUTO Only table are the same as those for MapPLUTO. DCP Mapping Lots includes some features that are not on the tax maps. They have been added by DCP for cartographic purposes. They include street center 'malls', traffic islands and some built streets through parks. These features have very few associated attributes.
descript.purpose: MapPLUTO was created by the Department of City Planning to meet the growing need for extensive land use and geographic data at the tax lot level in PC mapping format.
descript.supplinf: The definition of two special districts are modified: Mixed Use District - 2 Fulton Ferry (BK) has been changed to Mixed Use District - 2 Dumbo (BK); Mixed Use District - 11 Bond St/Gowanus (BK) has been changed to Mixed Use District - 11 Gowanus (BK).

sngdate.caldate: DCP - Political and Administrative District Data - 12/1/2009

idinfo.accconst: BYTES of the BIG APPLE (TM) MapPLUTO files are a licensed product of the NYC Department of City Planning and may only be used through a license granted by the Department. This product is licensed under terms and conditions of a separate "License Agreement" with City Planning that contains, among other things, provisions with respect to ownership, permitted and prohibited uses, third-party agreements, warranty and termination. Refer to the License Agreement for the full text of obligations and rights with respect to the use of this product.
idinfo.useconst: The information contained in these files was initially compiled for governmental use by the New York City Department of City Planning. The Department and City make no representation as to the accuracy of the information or its suitability for any purpose. The Department and City disclaim any liability for errors that may be contained herein and shall not be responsible for any damages, consequential or actual, arising out of or in connection with the use of the information.

cntinfo.cntpos: BYTES of the BIG APPLE Coordinator

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

attracc.attraccr: The Department of City Planning makes no assurances about the accuracy of these data.

horizpa.horizpar: The MapPLUTO files are created from the Department of Finance's Tax Lot Polygon feature class in DTM.

dataqual.complete: The spatial features of MapPLUTO 10V1 are derived from the Department of Finance's Digital Tax Map (DTM) from March 4, 2010.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.
attr.attrdefs: ESRI

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
attr.attrdefs: ESRI

attr.attrdef: The borough in which the tax lot is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: Two portions of the city, Marble Hill and Rikers Island, are each legally located in one borough but are serviced by different boroughs. The BOROUGH codes associated with these areas are the boroughs they are legally located in. Specifically, Marble Hill is serviced by the Bronx but is legally located in Manhattan and has a Manhattan BOROUGH code. Rikers Island has a Bronx BOROUGH code because it is legally located in the Bronx although it is serviced by Queens.

attr.attrdef: The tax block in which the tax lot is located. Each tax block is unique within a borough (see BOROUGH).
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: The number of the tax lot. Each tax lot is unique within a tax block (see BLOCK).
attr.attrdefs: DCP based on data from Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: Each unit in a building that is a condominium is defined by the Department of Finance as a separate tax lot. To make condominium information more compatible with parcel information, the Department of City Planning aggregated condominium unit tax lot information so that each condominium complex within a tax block is represented by only one tax lot record. A condominium complex is defined as one or more structures or properties under the auspicies of the same condominium association. The Department of City Planning then assigned the condominium billing tax lot number to the condominium complex tax lot record. If the Department of Finance has not yet assigned a billing tax lot number to the condominium complex then the lowest tax lot number within the condominium complex was used. The Department of Finance DTM uses the formerly known as (FKA) Tax Lot number for Condominiums. The Department of City Planning has modified the Tax Lot number of DOF DTM by replacing the FKA with the condominiums billing tax lot number. Often the tax lot number can tell you the type of tax lot. Of course there are exceptions to each convention. Usually tax lot number '1-999' correspond with traditional tax lots; '1001-6999' correspond with condominium unit lots; '7501-7599' correspond with condominiun billing lots; '8000-8899' correspond with subterranean tax lots; '8900-8999' correspond with DTM dummy tax lots; '9000-9899' correspond with air right tax lots.

edom.edomvd: Staten Island Gateway National Recreation Area (JIA)

attr.attrdef: The community district (CD) or joint interest area (JIA) the tax lot is located in, or partially located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Digital Tax Map (DTM) modified by DCP; Department of City Planning - CD layer in ArcGIS for DTM; Department of City Planning - Geosupport System; Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: The Department of City Planning - CD Layer for the DTM is used as the source when it identifies a community district for a tax lot. If a tax lot is split among more than one community district then PLUTO uses one of the community district numbers. If the Department of City Planning - CD Layer for the DTM does not identify a community district, the district is obtained from the Department of City Planning Geosupport System. If the community district is not available from the Geosupport System the DOF-RPAD Master file is used. If a tax lot is split by a community district boundary, only one community district is retained.Two portions of the city, Marble Hill and Rikers Island, are legally located in one borough and are each serviced by different boroughs. The COMMUNITY DISTRICT codes associated with these areas are the community districts they are serviced by. Specifically, Marble Hill is legally located in Manhattan but is serviced by the Bronx and has Bronx COMMUNITY DISTRICT codes of 207 or 208. Rikers Island has a Queens COMMUNITY DISTRICT code of 401 since it is serviced by Queens even though it is legally located in the Bronx.
attrvai.attrva: Only one data source is used per tax lot.

attr.attrdef: The 2000 US census tract in which the tax lot is located. Each census tract is unique within a borough.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - Geosupport System

attrvai.attrvae: 2000 census tracts a geographic areas defined by the US Census Bureau for the 2000 Census. If a tax lot is split by a census tract boundary, only one census tract is retained.

attr.attrdef: The 2000 census block in which the tax lot is located. Each census block is unique within a census tract (see CT2000).
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - Geosupport System

attrvai.attrvae: 2000 census blocks are the smallest geographic areas reported on by the U.S. Census Bureau for the 2000 census. If a tax lot is split by a census block boundary, only one census block is retained.

attr.attrdef: The community school district in which the tax lot is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - Geosupport System

attrvai.attrvae: If a tax lot is split by a school district boundary, only one school district is retained.

attr.attrdef: The city council district in which the tax lot is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - Geosupport System

attrvai.attrvae: There are currently 51 city council districts in the City, which serve as administrative districts for the legislative branch of city government. If a tax lot is split by a city council district boundary, only one city council district is retained.

attr.attrdef: The zip code that the tax lot is located in.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File, Department of City Planning - Geosupport System

attrvai.attrvae: The zip code is obtained from the Department of City Planning- Geosupport System. If the zip code is not available from Geosupport, the DOF-RPAD Master File is used. If a tax lot is split by a zip code boundary, only one zip code is retained.

attr.attrdef: The fire company that services the tax lot. This field consists of four characters, the first of which is an alphabetic code identifying the type of fire company, where E stands for Engine and L stands for Ladder. The type code is followed by a one to three digit fire company number which is preceded with leading zeros if the company number is less than three digits.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - Geosupport System

edom.edomvd: Staten Island Fire Company Districts - Engine
Staten Island Fire Company Districts - Ladder

attr.attrdef: The health area in which the tax lot is located. Health areas are administrative districts comprised of aggregates of census tracts, which are used by the Health Department for statistical data collection.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning- Geosupport System

attrvai.attrvae: If a tax lot is split by a health area boundary, only one health area is retained.

attr.attrdef: The health center district in which the tax lot is located. Heath Center Districts are administrative districts comprised of health areas (see HEALTHAREA).
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning- Geosupport System

attrvai.attrvae: If a tax lot is split by a health center district boundary, only one health center district is retained.

attr.attrdef: The police precinct in which the tax lot is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - Geosupport System

attrvai.attrvae: If a tax lot is split by a police precinct boundary, only one police precinct is retained.

attr.attrdef: An address for the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: The general format is house number or low house number, if there is a house number range, and a space followed by a street name. Queens house numbers contain a hyphen. Some tax lots, such as vacant lots or parks, have a street name and no house number.

edom.edomvd: Park property of NYS Office of Parks, Recreation, and Historic Preservation.

attr.attrdef: The zoning district classification of the tax lot. If the tax lot is divided by a zoning boundary line, ZoneDist1 represents the primary zoning district classification occupying the greatest percentage of the tax lot's area. Properties under the jurisdiction of NYC Department of Parks and Recreation are coded PARK. Properties under the jurisdiction of NYS Office of Parks, Recreation, and Historic Preservation are coded PARKNY. DROP LOT is a designation that City Planning devised to identify tax lots that no longer exist in the DCP version of the Digital Tax Map but have not yet been removed from the Department of Finance RPAD File. RPAD retains tax lots that have been dropped, due to merger, reapportionment or conversion to condominium, until the end of the City's Fiscal Year. To avoid confusion DROP LOT was created to identify these lots.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File, NYC Zoning Resolution Zoning Maps

attrvai.attrvae: Only one data source is used per tax lot. See SplitZone to determine if the tax lot is divided.

attr.attrdef: If the tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, ZoneDist2 represents the primary zoning classification occupying the second greatest percentage of the tax lot's area. If the tax lot is not divided by a zoning boundary line, the field is blank.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File, NYC Zoning Resolution Zoning Maps.

attrvai.attrvae: See SplitZone to determine if the tax lot is divided.

attr.attrdef: If the tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, ZoneDist3 represents the primary zoning classification occupying the third greatest percentage of the tax lot's area. If the tax lot is not divided by a zoning boundary line, the field is blank.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File, NYC Zoning Resolution Zoning Maps

attrvai.attrvae: See SplitZone to determine if the tax lot is divided.

attr.attrdef: If the tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, ZoneDist4 represents the primary zoning classification occupying the fourth greatest percentage of the tax lot's area. If the tax lot is not divided by a zoning boundary line, the field is blank.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File, NYC Zoning Resolution Zoning Maps

attrvai.attrvae: See SplitZone to determine if the tax lot is divided.

attr.attrdef: The commercial overlay assigned to the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File, NYC Zoning Resolution Zoning Maps

attrvai.attrvae: If more than one commercial overlay exist on the tax lot, Overlay1 represents the commercial overlay occupying the greatest precentage of the lot area. If the tax lot is divided by zoning boundary line, Overlay1 could be associated with either ZoneDist1 or ZoneDist2. See split zone to determine if the tax lot is divided.

attr.attrdef: A commercial overlay associated with the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File, NYC Zoning Resolution Zoning Maps

attrvai.attrvae: If the tax lot has only one zoning district, Overlay2 represents the commercial overlay occupying the second largest percentageof the tax lot's area. If the tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, Overlay2 could be associated with either ZoneDist1 or ZoneDist2. See split zone to determine if the tax lot is divided.

attr.attrdef: The special purpose or limited height district assigned to the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File, NYC Zoning Resolution Zoning Maps

attrvai.attrvae: If more than special district exists on the tax lot, SPDist1 represents the special district or limited height designation occupying the greatest precentage of the lot area. If the tax lot is divided by a zoning boundary line SPDist1 could be associated with any of the zoning district fields. See split zone to determine if the tax lot is divided.

edom.edomvd: Limited Height District No. 1 (Gramercy Park/Brooklyn Heights/Cobble Hill)
Limited Height District No. 1A (Upper East Side)
Long Island City Mixed Use District
Mixed Use District-9 Northern Hunters Point Waterfront (QN)
Mixed Use District-10 Atlantic and Howard Avenues (BK)

attr.attrdef: The special purpose or limited height district assigned to the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File, NYC Zoning Resolution Zoning Maps

attrvai.attrvae: If the tax lot has only one zoning district, ZONING, SPECIAL PURPOSE DISTRICT 2 represents the special district or limited height designation occupying the second greatest percentage of the lot area. If the tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, ZONING, SPECIAL PURPOSE DISTRICT 2 could be associated with any of the ZONING, ZONING DISTRICT fields. See SplitZone to determine if the tax lot is divided.

attr.attrdef: Consists of the primary zoning classification occupying the greatest percentage of the tax lot's area and a commercial overlay and special purpose or limited height district assigned to the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File, NYC Zoning Resolution Zoning Maps

attrvai.attrvae: If a tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, AllZoning1 may contain zoning components from various portions of the lot. See split zone to determine if the tax lot is split.

attr.attrdef: If the tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, AllZoning2 consists of the primary zoning classification occupying the second greatest percentage of the tax lot's area and a commercial overlay and special purpose or limited height district assigned to the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File, NYC Zoning Resolution Zoning Maps

attrvai.attrvae: If a tax lot is divided by zoning boundary lines, zoning2 may contain zoning components from various portions of the lot. See SplitZone to determine if the tax lot is split.

attr.attrdef: A code indicating whether the tax lot is split by one or more zoning boundary lines.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Zoning File. NYC Zoning Resolution Zoning Maps

attrvai.attrva: Less than 2% of the tax lots are split.

attr.attrdef: A code describing the major use of structures on the tax lot.

attrvai.attrvae: If there are multiple uses or buildings on a tax lot, the building class describes the use with the greatest square footage on the tax lot. Several building classes describe mixed use buildings (combinations of residential and office or retail uses). The Department of Finance has added a new Building Class RR. RR now refers to Condominium Rental. The Condominium Residential Building Class for mixed residential condo building classification codes is now RA.

edom.edomvd: Two Story Detatched (Small or Moderate Size, With or Without Attic)
Miscellaneous (Old Buildings, Attached & Semi-Detached Frame Houses, etc)
Garden Apartments / Mobile Home Park / Trailer Park
Gas Station - With Enclosed Lubrication Plant or Workshop
Gas Station - Without Enclosed Lubrication Plant or Workshop
Legitimate Theaters (Theater Sole Use of Building)
Theater as Part of Building of Other Use
Two Story or Store and Office
Over Eight Stores (Mid-Manhattan Type With or Without Stores)
Fireproof - Loft and Storage Type (Without Retail Stores)
Homes for Indigent Children, Aged, Homelss
Places of Public Assembly (Indoor) and Cultural
Miscellaneous Including Riding Academies and Stables
Residential Building (Mixed Residential Condo Building Classification Codes)
Commercial Building (Mixed Commercial Condo Building Classification Codes)
Mixed Residential & Commercial Building (Mixed Residential & Commercial Condo Building Classification Codes)
Primarily One Family with Two Stores or Offices
Primarliy One Family with Store or Office
Primarily Two Family with Store or Office
Primarily Three Family with Store or Office
Primarily Four Family with Store or Office
Primarily Five to Six Family with Store or Office
Primarily One to Six Families with Stores or Offices
Miscellaneous (Including Private Improvements in City Land and in Public Places)
Zoned Residential, Except Not Manhattan Below 110 St
Not Zoned Residential or Manhattan Below 110 St
Not Zoned Residential , But Adjacent to Tax Class 1 Dwelling
Zoned Primarily Residential, Except Not Manhattan below 110 St
Port Authority of NY and NJ
Miscellaneous (Deparment of Real Estate and Other Public Places)
Public Elementary Junior and Senior High Schools
Selected Government Installations (Excluding Office Buildings, Training Schools, Academic, Garages, Warehouses, Piers, Air Fields, Vacant Land, Vacant Sites, and Land Under Water and Easments)
Tennis Court, Pool, Shed, etc. Used in Conjunction with Tax Class 1

attr.attrdefs: Deparment of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: A code for the tax lot's land use category, modified for display of parks, New York City Department of Parks and Recreation properties and New York State Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation properties in the appropriate category on land use maps.

attrvai.attrvae: A tax lot's land use category is derived from the lot's building class (see BldgClass). The Department of City Planning assigned building classes to the most appropriate land use category. Park properties were identified using data sources other than the DOF Building Classes and, where appropriate, were classified with a Land Use Category of 09- Open Space and Outdoor Recreation, regardless of the tax lot's building class.

attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - based on data from: Department of Finance-RPAD Master File, NYC - Zoning Resolution Zoning Maps, Department of Parks and Recreation - Property Maps, New York State Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation - List of Properties

attr.attrdef: The number of easements on the tax lot. If the number is zero, the tax lot has no easement.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

edom.edomvd: Other - Public Authority, State or Federal Ownership
Private Ownership - Either the tax lot has started an "in rem" action or it was onced city owned.
Mixed (Excludes property with a C, M, O, or P ownership code). Fully tax exempt property that could be owned by the city, state, or federal government; a public authority; or a private institution.

attr.attrdef: A code indicating type of ownership for the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Citywide Administrative Services - IPIS, Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: It is recommended that OwnerName be referenced to verify the type of ownership, specifically when state and federal government and public authority ownership is important.

attr.attrdef: The name of the owner of the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: Total area of the tax lot, expressed in square feet rounded to the nearest
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: Lot Area contains street beds when the tax lot contains paper streets, i.e. streets mapped but not built. If the tax lot is not an irregularly shaped lot (IrrLotCode) the Department of Finance derives the Lot Area by multiplying the Lot Frontage by the Lot Depth. If the tax lot is irregularly shaped Finance manually calculates the Lot Area from the Tax Maps. If the lot area is zero, data is not available for the tax lot.

attr.attrdef: The total gross area in square feet.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Mass Appraisal System; Department of Finance- RPAD Master File, Department of Finance - Major Property File

attrvai.attrvae: If AreaSource field has a code of 1 or 2, the total floor area is for all of the buildings on the tax lot. Measurements are based on exterior dimensions. The building floor area is calculated by multiplying the building footprint by the number of stories, where the number of stories includes all full and partial stories above the ground floor or above grade. If the AreaSource field has a value of 5, the floor area was calculated from the DOF RPAD Master File using the building dimensions and number of stories for ONLY the largest building on the tax lot. The sum of ComArea and ResArea does not always equal the floor area. A TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. If NUMBER OF BUILDINGS is greater than zero, then a TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA of zero means it is not available. If NUMBER OF BUILDINGS is zero, then a TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA of zero means it is not applicable.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for commercial use.

attrvai.attrvae: The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA. A COMMERCIAL FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable.

attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Mass Appraisal System; Department of Finance - Major Property File. The Mass Appraisal System is used as the source if commercial floor area is available; otherwise the Major Property File is used.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for residential use.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance- Mass Appraisal System, Department of Finance - Major Property File. The Mass Appraisal System is used as the source if residential floor area is available; otherwise the Major Property File is used.

attrvai.attrvae: The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA. A RESIDENTIAL FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for office use.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- Mass Appraisal System

attrvai.attrvae: The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA. An OFFICE FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. This information is NOT available for one, two or three family structures.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for retail use.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- Mass Appraisal System

attrvai.attrvae: The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA. A RETAIL FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. This information is NOT available for one, two or three family structures.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for garage use.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- Mass Appraisal System

attrvai.attrvae: The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA. A GARAGE FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. This information is NOT available for one, two or three family structures.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for storage or loft purposes.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- Mass Appraisal System

attrvai.attrvae: The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA. A STORAGE FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. This information is NOT available for one, two or three family structures.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for factory use.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- Mass Appraisal System

attrvai.attrvae: The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA. A FACTORY FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. This information is NOT available for one, two or three family structures.

attr.attrdef: An estimate of the exterior dimensions of the portion of the building(s) allocated for other than Residential, Office, Retail, Garage, Storage, Loft or Factory use.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- Mass Appraisal System

attrvai.attrvae: The sum of the various FLOOR AREAs does not always equal TOTAL BUILDING FLOOR AREA. An OTHER FLOOR AREA of zero can mean it is either not available or not applicable. This information is NOT available for one, two or three family structures.

edom.edomvd: Department of Finance's Major Property File
One or more Building Dimensions are non-numeric. Total Building Floor Area is 0.
Building Class is 'V' and Number of Buildings is 0. Total Building Floor Area is 0.
Total Building Floor Area is calculated from RPAD Building Dimensions and Number of Stories for largest building only.
Department of Finance's Mass Appraisal System

attr.attrdef: A code indicating the source file that was used to determine the tax lot's total building floor area.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning

attr.attrdef: The number of buildings on the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on: Department of City Planning - GeoSupport System; Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrva: With few exceptions, buildings are permanent structures. If an assessor values a semi-permanent structure, such as a parking attendants building, then it is considered a building.

attr.attrdef: In the primary building on the tax lot, the number of full and partial stories starting from the ground floor.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: If the number of floors (NumFloors) is zero and the number of buildings(NumBldgs) is greater than zero, the number of floors(NumFloors) is not available for the tax lot. If the number of floors (NumFloors) is zero and the number of buildings is zero, then the number of floors is not applicable for the tax lot.
Hotels/motels, nursing homes and SROs do not have residential units, while boarding houses do have residential units.

attr.attrdef: The sum of residential units in all buildings on the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: The sum of residential and non-residential (offices, retail stores, etc.) units in all buildings on the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: The count of non-residential units is sometimes not available if the building contains residential units.

attr.attrdef: The tax lot's frontage measured in feet.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: The tax lot's depth measured in feet.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance-RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: The building's frontage along the street measured in feet.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: The building's depth, which is the effective perpendicular distance, measured in feet.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: The physical relationship of the building to neighboring buildings.
A code indicating whether the tax lot is irregularly shaped.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: A code indicating the location of the tax lot to another tax lot and/or the water.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Mass Appraisal System

edom.edomvd: Block Assemblage - A tax lot which encompasses an entire block.
Waterfront - A tax lot bordering on a body of water. Waterfront lots may contain a small amount of submerged land.
Corner - A tax lot bordering on two intersecting streets

Through - A tax lot which connects two streets and fronts on both streets. A lot with two frontages is not necessarily a through lot. For example, an L-shaped lot with two frontages would be coded as an Inside Lot (5).
Inside - A tax lot which is not an assemblage, waterfront, corner, through, interior, island, alley or submerged lot.
Interior Lot - A tax lot that has no street frontage.
Island Lot - A tax lot that is entirely surrounded by water.
Alley Lot - A tax lot that is too narrow to accommodate a building. The lot is usually 12 feet or less in width.
Submerged Land Lot - A tax lot that is totally or almost completely submerged.

attr.attrdef: A code describing the basement type/grade.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance - Mass Appraisal System.This information is ONLY available for one, two or three family structures.

edom.edomvd: Full Basement that is Above Grade. The basement is 75% or more of the area of the first floor and the basement walls are at least 4 feet high on at least two sides.
Full Basement that is Below Grade. The basement is 75% or more of the area of the first floor and the basement walls are fully submerged or are less than 4 feet on at least three sides.
Partial Basement that is Above Grade. The basement is between 25% and 75% of the area of the first floor and the basement walls are at least 4 feet high on at least two sides.
Partial Basement that is Below Grade. The basement is between 25% and 75% of the area of the first floor and the basement walls are fully submerged or are less than 4 feet on at least three sides.

attrvai.attrvae: All basements in brownstones, high ranches, split-levels and attached row houses are Above Grade. A fully exposed basement garage door does not, in itself, satisfy the criteria for Above Grade.

attr.attrdef: The tentative actual assessed land value for Fiscal Year 2011
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: The Department of Finance calculates the assessed value by multiplying the tax lot's estimated full market land value, determined as if vacant and unimproved, by a uniform percentage for the property's tax class.

attr.attrdef: The tentative actual assessed total value for Fiscal Year 2011.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: The Department of Finance calculates the assessed value by multiplying the tax lot's estimated full market value by a uniform percentage for the property's tax class.

attr.attrdef: The tentative actual exempt land value, which is determined differently for each exemption program, is the dollar amount related to that portion of the tax lot that has received an exemption or abatement for Fiscal Year 2011.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: The tentative actual exempt total value, which is determined differently for each exemption program, is the dollar amount related to that portion of the tax lot that has received an exemption or abatement for Fiscal Year 2011.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: The year construction of the building was completed.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

edom.edomvd: Year Built is not an Estimate

attr.attrdef: A code indicating whether the year the building was built (YearBuilt) was an estimate.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: The year of the most recent alteration.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: If the alteration spanned more than one year, YearAlter1 is the year the alteration began, otherwise it is the year the alteration was completed. The date can either be the actual date or an estimate. The Department of Finance defines modifications to the structure that, according to the assesor, changes the value of the real property.

attr.attrdef: The year of the second most recent alteration.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: If the alteration spanned more than one year, YearAlter2 is the year the alteration began, otherwise it is the year the alteration was completed. The date can either be the actual date or an estimate. The Department of Finance defines modifications to the structure that, according to the assesor, changes the value of the real property.

attr.attrdef: The name of the Historic District as designated by the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - based on data from: Landmarks Preservation Commission - Guide to New York City Landmarks Landmarks Preservation Commission Web Site - www.nyc.gov\landmarks Landmarks Preservation Commission Historic District Polygon File

attr.attrdef: The name of an individual landmark, landmark site (e.g. Richmondtown Restoration), or an interior landmark, as designated by the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Landmarks Preservation Commission - Guide to New York City Landmarks, Landmarks Preservation Commission Web Site - www.nyc.gov\landmarks

attr.attrdef: The Built Floor Area Ratio (FAR) is the total building floor area divided by the area of the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: The calculation by City Planning is based on rough building and lot measurements provided by the Department of Finance. FAR is calculated using the TotlArea and the LotArea. The LotArea contains street beds when the lot contains paper streets, i.e., streets mapped but not built.

attr.attrdef: Either the Maximum Allowable Residential Floor Area Ratio (FAR) or the Maximum Allowable Commercial FAR. This field contains from one to four numeric digits with an imbedded decimal after the second digit.

attrvai.attrvae: If ZONING, ALL COMPONENTS 1 begins with M (manufacturing) or C (commercial) and Maximum Allowable Commercial FAR is greater than or equal to the Maximum Allowable Residential FAR then the Maximum Allowable Commercial FAR is displayed. If ZONING, ALL COMPONENTS 1 begins with M (manufacturing) or C (commercial) and Maximum Allowable Residential FAR is greater than the Maximum Allowable Commercial FAR then the Maximum Allowable Residential FAR is displayed. If ZONING, ALL COMPONENTS 1 begins with R (residential) then the Maximum Allowable Residential FAR is displayed. The Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratios are exclusive of bonuses for plazas, plaza-connected open areas, arcades or other amenities. For properties zoned R6, R7, R7-1,R8 or R9 the Maximum Allowable Floor Area reflects the maximum achievable floor area under ideal conditions. For properties in Mixed Use Special Districts, PLUTO uses the wide street Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratio. Since the Maximum Allowable Floor Area Ratio in Mixed Use Special Districts is actually determined by whether the property is located on a wide street or a narrow street, users should change PLUTO's Maximum Allowable Floor Area for properties located on narrow streets. Questions related to the Maximum Allowable Floor Area for specific tax lots should be directed to the Department of City Planning Zoning Information Desk 212.720.3291.

attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File, NYC - Zoning Resolution Zoning Map

attr.attrdef: The borough the tax lot is located in.
attr.attrdefs: Deparment of City Planning based on data from: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: Two portions of the city, Marble Hill and Rikers Island, are each legally located in one borough but are serviced by different boroughs. The BoroCode associated with these areas are the boroughs they are legally located in. Specifically, Marble Hill is serviced by the Bronx but is legally located in Manhattan and has a Manhattan BoroCode. Rikers Island has a Bronx BoroCode because it is legally located in the Bronx although it is serviced by Queens.

attr.attrdef: A concatenation of the BoroCode, TaxBlock and the corresponding TaxLot. This field consists of the tax block followed by the tax lot. The tax block is one to five numeric digits, preceded with leading zeros when the block is less than five digits. The tax lot is one to four digits and is preceded with leading zeros when the lot is less than four digits. The tax block is one to five digits and is preceded with leading zeros when the lot is less than five digits.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Plannig based on data from: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: The condominium number assigned to the complex.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance- RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: The 2000 census tract that the tax lot is located in.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning- Geosupport System

attrvai.attrvae: 2000 Census Tracts geographic areas defined by the US Census Bureau for the 2000 Census. If a tax lot is split by a census tract boundary, only one census tract is retained.

attr.attrdef: The X coordinate of the XY coordinate pair which depicts the approximate location of the address.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning- Geosupport System

attrvai.attrvae: The XY coordinates are expressed in the New York- Long Island State Plane Coordinate System (NAD83).

attr.attrdef: The Y coordinate of the XY coordinate pair which depicts the approximate location of the address.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning- Geosupport System

attrvai.attrvae: The XY coordinates are expressed in the New York- Long Island State Plane Coordinate System (NAD83).

attr.attrdef: The Department of City Planning Zoning Map Number associated with the tax lot's X and Y coordinates.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - Geosupport System

attr.attrdef: A code(Y) identifies a border Tax Lot, i.e., a Tax Lot on the border of two or more Zoning Maps.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - Geosupport System

attr.attrdef: The Sanborn Map Company map number associated with the tax block and lot. Sanborn map number format is Borough Code / Volume Number / Page Number.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - Geosupport System

attr.attrdef: The Department of Finance paper tax map Volume Number associated with the tax block and lot. Tax map number format is Borough Code / Volume Number / Page Number. The Department of Finance no longer updates their paper tax maps.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - Geosupport System

attr.attrdef: The E-Designation number assigned to the tax lot.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - E - Designation File

attr.attrdef: The originating Borough, Tax Block and Tax Lot from the apportionment prior to the merge, split or property's conversion to a condominium. The Apportionment BBL is only available for mergers, splits and conversions since 1984.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - based on data from: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attr.attrdef: The date of the Apportionment in the format MM/DD/YYYY.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - based on data from: Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

edom.edomvd: Standard - Non condo tax lot polygons; BBL is not changed
Split - One base bbl has multiple billing bbls - Program assigned billing bbl .
Split - One base bbl has multiple billing bbls - Manually assigned billing bbl
Merge - Multiple condo tax lot polygons have same bbl
Merge - Multiple non condo tax lot polygons have same bbl
Missing - Lowest unit bbl is assigned as billing bbl
Missing - Keep base bbl as billing bbl
Normal - Normally assigned billing bbl - one base bbl has one corresponding billing bbl
Skip - Non condo records are mistakenly stored in condo table

attr.attrdef: The Department of Finance's DTM handles condominium lots differently from many other MapPLUTO sources. The DTM Tax Lot Polygon feature class uses the base borough - block - lot (BBL) as the unique identifier of a parcel currently occupied by a condominium. The Department of City Planning and some of the other data sources for MapPLUTO use the billing bbl for condominiums. Therefore, in creating MapPLUTO from DTM, DCP has had to reassign the billing bbl as the primary key for condominium tax parcels. In most cases, there is one to one relationship between the DTM's base bbl and MapPLUTO's billing bbl. In some cases, further processing has been necessary. In a very few cases, non-condominium tax lots have also been modified. All of these cases are identified in the MapPluto Flag field. The data type for MapPLUTO flag is a number, each number represents how the base bbl is reassigned.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning - ArcGIS Team

edom.edomvd: In PLUTO Data File and DOF Modified DTM Tax Block and Lot Clipped to the Shoreline File.
In DOF Modified DTM Tax Block and Lot Clipped to the Shoreline File but NOT in PLUTO.
In PLUTO Data File and in DOF Modified DTM File but NOT in DOF Modified DTM Tax Block and Lot Clipped to the Shoreline File, therefore the tax lot is totally under water.
In DOF Modified DTM but NOT in PLUTO, therefore the tax lot is totally under water.

attr.attrdef: A code indicating whether the tax lot is in the PLUTO file and/or the modified DTM and/or the modified DTM Clipped to the Shoreline File.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Finance Digital Tax Map Modified by DCP, Department of Finance Digital Tax Map Modified by DCP Clipped to the Shoreline File, Department of Finance - RPAD Master File

attrvai.attrvae: The tax lot will not appear in the MapPLUTO geodatabase if the lot is found only in the PLUTO data file. If the tax lot has a PLUTO-Base Map Indicator code of 3 or 5, then the PLUTO record will only contain data in the borough, tax block, tax lot, community district and PLUTO-Base Map Indicator fields.

attr.attrdef: The version of MapPLUTO.
attr.attrdefs: Department of City Planning

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.
attr.attrdefs: ESRI

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

cntinfo.cntpos: BYTES of the BIG APPLE Coordinator

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000
